chinese: [U] 机器人（制造与应用）学
[U] 瑜伽
completely get rid of sth. that is unnecessary or unwanted 消除；根除
examples: e.g. There is no solution that will totally [[eliminate]] the possibility of theft.

chinese: 1) the practice of limiting your interests or activities to one particular subject 专业化；专门化
examples: e.g. Increased [[specialization]] has reduced the number of doctors who are good at managing emergencies.；e.g. His [[specialization]] in translation led him to start his own company.

chinese: 2) an activity or subject that you know a lot about 专业
examples: e.g. Increased [[specialization]] has reduced the number of doctors who are good at managing emergencies.；e.g. His [[specialization]] in translation led him to start his own company.

chinese: (BrE also routinise) if you routinize a way of doing sth., you make it a normal part of a job or process 使惯例化；使成常规
examples: e.g. To improve efficiency, [[routinize]] as much of your morning as possible.

chinese: start using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people 使自动化
examples: e.g. Massive investment is needed to [[automate]] the production process.

chinese: [C] (disc jockey) sb. who plays records on a radio show or in a club where you can dance （电台）音乐唱片节目主持人；（俱乐部）打碟师，舞曲唱片播放员
as a result 结果；因此；所以
examples: e.g. The company is trying to reduce its costs; [[consequently]], staff who leave are not being replaced.

chinese: judge how good, useful, or successful sth. is 评估；评价
examples: e.g. It can be difficult to [[evaluate]] the effectiveness of different medical treatments.

chinese: [C] (technical) 演算法；计算程序
make sb. think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skillfully deceiving or influencing them 操纵，控制（某人的思想和行为）
examples: e.g. As a politician, he knows how to [[manipulate]] public opinion.

chinese: (also mystic) (usu. before noun) having spiritual powers or qualities that are difficult to understand or to explain 神秘的；不可思议的；难以解释的
examples: e.g. Watching the sun rise over the mountain was an almost [[mystical]] experience.

chinese: connected with the chemistry of living things 生物化学的
examples: e.g. People can become addicted to the [[biochemical]] changes brought about by vigorous exercise.

chinese: (usu. before noun) using measurements of human features, such as fingers or eyes, in order to identify people 生物特征识别的
examples: e.g. The major [[biometric]] methods include face, voice, and fingerprint recognition.

chinese: 1) guess sth. using as many facts as you can find 预测；估计
examples: e.g. Researchers [[calculated]] that this group was at a higher risk of heart disease.；e.g. You should [[calculate]] how much time this assignment will take before you start doing it.

chinese: 2) find out how much sth. will cost, how long sth. will take, etc., by using numbers 计算；核算
examples: e.g. Researchers [[calculated]] that this group was at a higher risk of heart disease.；e.g. You should [[calculate]] how much time this assignment will take before you start doing it.

chinese: [C, U] a careful examination of sth. in order to understand it better （对事物的）分析
examples: e.g. At the meeting, they presented a detailed [[analysis]] of 12 schools in London.

chinese: 1) the information produced by a computer （计算机的）输出信息
examples: e.g. You run the software, you look at the [[output]], and then you make modifications (修改).；e.g. Government statistics show the largest drop in industrial [[output]] for 10 years.

chinese: 2) the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory, etc. 产量；产品
examples: e.g. You run the software, you look at the [[output]], and then you make modifications (修改).；e.g. Government statistics show the largest drop in industrial [[output]] for 10 years.

chinese: make sth. so that it is exactly right for sb.'s particular needs or for a particular purpose 根据特定需要制作；定做
examples: e.g. Most travel agents are willing to [[tailor]] travel arrangements to meet individual requirements.

chinese: [U] a feeling of extreme unhappiness 忧虑；苦恼；悲伤
examples: e.g. Luke's poor academic performance caused his parents great [[distress]].

chinese: [C] a tune, esp. the main tune in a piece of music written for several instruments or voices 旋律；曲调；（尤指）主旋律
examples: e.g. They played some lovely [[melodies]] at the end of the concert.

chinese: [C] sth. that is a feature of only one particular place, person, situation, etc. （某地方、某人或某情况等的）特点，独特性
examples: e.g. A sharp ringing in the ears is a [[peculiarity]] of the disease.

chinese: [U] 催产素
1) write a piece of music 作（曲）
examples: e.g. Mozart [[composed]] his last opera shortly before he passed away.；e.g. The committee is [[composed]] of doctors, nurses and members of the public.

chinese: 2) (be composed of) be formed from a number of substances, parts, or people 由···组成
examples: e.g. Mozart [[composed]] his last opera shortly before he passed away.；e.g. The committee is [[composed]] of doctors, nurses and members of the public.

chinese: (BrE also personalised) adapted to personal requirements or tastes 个性化的
examples: e.g. His car has a [[personalized]] number plate.

chinese: apart from sb. / sth.; in addition to sb. / sth. 除···之外（还）
examples: e.g. I've got no family [[besides]] my parents.

chinese: be even better or greater than sb. / sth. else 超过；胜过
examples: e.g. The film's success has [[surpassed]] all expectations.

chinese: be more successful than sb. / sth. else 做得比···好；胜过
examples: e.g. In recent years, our economy has [[outperformed]] most other industrial economies.

chinese: the type of work sb. does 专业；行业
examples: e.g. You can expect to meet some very interesting people in my [[line of work]].

chinese: later in the future, not immediately 从长远来看
examples: e.g. It seems a lot of effort but I'm sure it's the best solution [[in the long run]].

chinese: used to emphasize that sb. has human feelings or weaknesses, often when contrasting them with machines 血肉之躯
examples: e.g. I am only [[flesh and blood]], like anyone else.

chinese: search or examine sth. very carefully 仔细搜查（检查）某物
examples: e.g. [[Go over]] your work before you hand it in.

chinese: (esp. AmE) realize and understand sth. such as your feelings and attitudes 认识到某事物，了解某事物（如自己的情感、态度等）
examples: e.g. I am finally able to [[get in touch with]] who I am.

chinese: become less sad, or make sb. feel less sad （使）高兴起来；（使）振作起来
examples: e.g. Here is a bit of news that will [[cheer up]] you.

english: sb.'s heart skips / misses a beat
chinese: used to say sb. suddenly feels a moment of fear, excitement, etc. 某人心跳停顿了一下（表示突然感到惊恐、兴奋等）
examples: e.g. My heart [[skipped a beat]] when I saw who it was.

chinese: remove sth. when you are preparing a book, a piece of film, etc. for printing or broadcasting （在编辑、剪辑等过程中）删除，去掉
examples: e.g. Anything offensive will be [[edited out]] at a later stage of the production.

chinese: use a feeling, fact, or idea in order to get what you want, often in an unfair way 利用（某一感情、事实或观点）
examples: e.g. The advertisement [[plays on]] our emotions, showing a doctor holding a newborn baby.

chinese: become popular and fashionable 流行
examples: e.g. The idea of glasses being a fashion item has been slow to [[catch on]].

english: stand / have a chance / hope (of doing sth.)
chinese: be likely to be able to do sth. or to succeed 有机会 / 有希望（做某事）
examples: e.g. She will [[stand a chance]] of passing the exam if she works hard.

chinese: 莫扎特（奥地利作曲家）
莎士比亚（英国剧作家、诗人）
弗丽达・卡洛（墨西哥画家）
